notesStmt.note: Inclomplete at the beginning. Lacuna after folio 167. Slight worming. Slight tidemarks in part. Fading ink.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 8 leaves each, marked by catchwords at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi (French?) semi-cursive script of the 14th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Dark brown leather. Spine: 'Constantinus Africanus. Viaticum. Hebrew. Mus. Brit. Jure Emptionis. 18,969.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Purchased by the British Museum through Asher & Co. on 12 June 1852: inscribed, folio [172v] (fse001v).
